verses.kjv: Simon Peter, a servant and an apostle of Jesus Christ, to them that have obtained like precious faith with us through the righteousness of God and our Saviour Jesus Christ:
verses.web: Simon Peter, a servant and apostle of Jesus Christ, to those who have obtained a like precious faith with us in the righteousness of our God and Savior, Jesus Christ:
verses.ct: From Simon Peter, a servant and apostle of Jesus Christ, to those who share the same precious faith we have — a faith given through the righteousness of our God and Savior, Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: Grace and peace be multiplied unto you through the knowledge of God, and of Jesus our Lord,
verses.web: Grace to you and peace be multiplied in the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord,
verses.ct: May grace and peace overflow in your lives as you grow in your knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord.

verses.kjv: According as his divine power hath given unto us all things that pertain unto life and godliness, through the knowledge of him that hath called us to glory and virtue:
verses.web: seeing that his divine power has granted to us all things that pertain to life and godliness, through the knowledge of him who called us by his own glory and virtue,
verses.ct: Through his divine power, God has given us everything we need for life and godliness. This comes through knowing the one who called us by his own glory and goodness.

verses.kjv: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.
verses.web: by which he has granted to us his precious and exceedingly great promises; that through these you may become partakers of the divine nature, having escaped from the corruption that is in the world by lust.
verses.ct: Through that glory and goodness, he has given us his incredible and precious promises, so that through them you can share in God's own nature, having escaped the corruption that evil desires bring into the world.

verses.kjv: And beside this, giving all diligence, add to your faith virtue; and to virtue knowledge;
verses.web: Yes, and for this very cause adding on your part all diligence, in your faith supply moral excellence; and in moral excellence, knowledge;
verses.ct: For this very reason, make every effort to build on your faith with moral excellence, and to moral excellence add knowledge,

verses.kjv: And to knowledge temperance; and to temperance patience; and to patience godliness;
verses.web: and in knowledge, self-control; and in self-control perseverance; and in perseverance godliness;
verses.ct: and to knowledge add self-control, and to self-control add perseverance, and to perseverance add godliness,

verses.kjv: And to godliness brotherly kindness; and to brotherly kindness charity.
verses.web: and in godliness brotherly affection; and in brotherly affection, love.
verses.ct: and to godliness add brotherly kindness, and to brotherly kindness add love.

verses.kjv: For if these things be in you, and abound, they make you that ye shall neither be barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.web: For if these things are yours and abound, they make you to not be idle or unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: If you possess these qualities in growing measure, they will keep you from being ineffective and unfruitful in your knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: But he that lacketh these things is blind, and cannot see afar off, and hath forgotten that he was purged from his old sins.
verses.web: For he who lacks these things is blind, seeing only what is near, having forgotten the cleansing from his old sins.
verses.ct: But anyone who lacks these qualities is blind and shortsighted, having forgotten that they were cleansed from their old sins.

verses.kjv: Wherefore the rather, brethren, give diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if ye do these things, ye shall never fall:
verses.web: Therefore, brothers, be more diligent to make your calling and election sure. For if you do these things, you will never stumble.
verses.ct: So, brothers and sisters, be all the more eager to confirm your calling and election. If you practice these things, you will never stumble.

verses.kjv: For so an entrance shall be ministered unto you abundantly into the everlasting kingdom of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.
verses.web: For thus you will be richly supplied with the entrance into the eternal Kingdom of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: And you will receive a rich and generous welcome into the eternal kingdom of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I will not be negligent to put you always in remembrance of these things, though ye know them, and be established in the present truth.
verses.web: Therefore I will not be negligent to remind you of these things, though you know them, and are established in the present truth.
verses.ct: That's why I will always keep reminding you of these things, even though you already know them and stand firm in the truth you've received.

verses.kjv: Yea, I think it meet, as long as I am in this tabernacle, to stir you up by putting you in remembrance;
verses.web: I think it right, as long as I am in this tent, to stir you up by reminding you,
verses.ct: I believe it's right for me, as long as I'm alive in this body, to keep stirring you up with these reminders.

verses.kjv: Knowing that shortly I must put off this my tabernacle, even as our Lord Jesus Christ hath shewed me.
verses.web: knowing that the putting off of my tent comes swiftly, even as our Lord Jesus Christ made clear to me.
verses.ct: I know that I will soon be leaving this body behind — our Lord Jesus Christ has made that clear to me.

verses.kjv: Moreover I will endeavour that ye may be able after my decease to have these things always in remembrance.
verses.web: Yes, I will make every effort that you may always be able to remember these things even after my departure.
verses.ct: So I will do everything I can to make sure that after I'm gone, you will always be able to remember these things.

verses.kjv: For we have not followed cunningly devised fables, when we made known unto you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but were eyewitnesses of his majesty.
verses.web: For we didn’t follow cunningly devised fables when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but we were eyewitnesses of his majesty.
verses.ct: When we told you about the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, we weren't repeating cleverly invented stories. We saw his majesty with our own eyes.

verses.kjv: For he received from God the Father honour and glory, when there came such a voice to him from the excellent glory, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
verses.web: For he received from God the Father honor and glory when the voice came to him from the Majestic Glory, “This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”
verses.ct: He received honor and glory from God the Father when a voice came to him from the Majestic Glory, saying, "This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased."

verses.kjv: And this voice which came from heaven we heard, when we were with him in the holy mount.
verses.web: We heard this voice come out of heaven when we were with him on the holy mountain.
verses.ct: We ourselves heard that voice speak from heaven when we were with him on the holy mountain.

verses.kjv: We have also a more sure word of prophecy; whereunto ye do well that ye take heed, as unto a light that shineth in a dark place, until the day dawn, and the day star arise in your hearts:
verses.web: We have the more sure word of prophecy; and you do well that you heed it, as to a lamp shining in a dark place, until the day dawns, and the morning star arises in your hearts:
verses.ct: Because of this, we have an even more certain word of prophecy. You would do well to pay attention to it, like a lamp shining in a dark place, until the day dawns and the morning star rises in your hearts.

verses.kjv: Knowing this first, that no prophecy of the scripture is of any private interpretation.
verses.web: knowing this first, that no prophecy of Scripture is of private interpretation.
verses.ct: Above all, understand this: no prophecy of Scripture comes from someone's own interpretation.

verses.kjv: For the prophecy came not in old time by the will of man: but holy men of God spake as they were moved by the Holy Ghost.
verses.web: For no prophecy ever came by the will of man: but holy men of God spoke, being moved by the Holy Spirit.
verses.ct: Prophecy never originated from human will. Instead, holy men of God spoke as they were carried along by the Holy Spirit.
